intro: Rungia membranacea, commonly known as the membranous rungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of rainforests. Rungia membranacea is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
